messages.content:
Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
@ (cross (V(sigin) - sigtrig_high,-1) ) Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
@ (cross (V(sigin) - sigtrig_low,-1) )

 Correction Criteria：Replaced 'sigtrig_low' with 'sigtrig_high', causing the lower trigger threshold to incorrectly use the upper threshold value. This disrupts the hysteresis behavior by making both state transitions depend on the same threshold (sigtrig_high), eliminating the intended deadband between sigtrig_high and sigtrig_low.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
      end else if (hyst_state == 1) begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
      end else begin

 Correction Criteria：Changing 'else' to 'else if (hyst_state == 1)' creates an unreachable condition. When hyst_state is 0, the sigout_low assignment is skipped since the condition fails, leaving sigout_val unassigned. This violates hysteresis behavior by preventing low-state output transitions.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real sigtrig_high = -1 ; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter integer hyst_state_init=-1; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
sigout_val = sigtrig_low; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
module hysteresis(sigin, sigout_wrong); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
      end else if (hyst_state == 2) begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
      end else begin

 Correction Criteria：The condition 'hyst_state == 2' is never true since hyst_state only takes values 0 or 1. This prevents the low output assignment when the hysteresis state is 0, causing sigout_val to retain its previous value (possibly high) instead of switching to low.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
      @ (cross (V(sigin) - sigtrig_high,-1) ) Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
      @ (cross (V(sigin) - sigtrig_low,-1) )

 Correction Criteria：Changed trigger condition from sigtrig_low to sigtrig_high. Now both triggers use the high threshold, eliminating hysteresis by making the low trigger identical to the high trigger. Output will toggle at the same input voltage level regardless of direction.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
output sigin; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
@ (cross (V(sigin) - sigtrig_high,-1) ) Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
@ (cross (V(sigin) - sigtrig_low,-1) )

 Correction Criteria：Changed trigger threshold from sigtrig_low to sigtrig_high. Now incorrectly triggers state transition to low when input falls below sigtrig_high instead of sigtrig_low, violating the hysteresis window specification.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real sigout_high = sigout_low; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
      @ (cross (V(sigin) - sigtrig_low,1) ) Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
      @ (cross (V(sigin) - sigtrig_high,1) )

 Correction Criteria：Changed trigger threshold from sigtrig_high to sigtrig_low. This causes premature state transition to high when input crosses the lower threshold (rising), violating the intended hysteresis behavior where transition should only occur at the higher threshold.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real trise = 0 from [0:inf); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
output sigin; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real sigout_low = sigout_high; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
if (hyst_state == 0) begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
if (hyst_state == 1) begin

 Correction Criteria：The condition is inverted, causing the output to be high when the state is low and low when the state is high. This swaps the hysteresis triggering behavior and violates the design specification.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
input sigout; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
module hysteresis(sigout, sigin); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real sigout_low = sigout_high; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
      @ ( initial_step('ic') ) begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
      @ ( initial_step ) begin

 Correction Criteria：Added invalid argument 'ic' to initial_step event. VerilogA initial_step takes no arguments, causing compilation failure. This prevents initialization of the hysteresis state, leaving it undefined throughout simulation.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   analg begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
   analog begin

 Correction Criteria：Misspelled keyword 'analog' as 'analg' which is not a valid VerilogA keyword

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   integer hyst_state Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
reel    sigout_val; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   analog begn Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
   analog begin

 Correction Criteria：Misspelled 'begin' as 'begn', causing a syntax error due to unrecognized keyword.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
              @ (cross (V(sigin) - sigtrig_low; -1) ) Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
              @ (cross (V(sigin) - sigtrig_low,-1) )

 Correction Criteria：Replaced comma with semicolon in cross function arguments, creating invalid separator between parameters

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
      @ ( initial_step  begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
      @ ( initial_step ) begin

 Correction Criteria：Missing closing parenthesis for the event control expression. The event control requires parentheses around the event expression.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
electrical sigin, sigout, Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real trise = 20n from (0;inf); Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
         sigout_val = sigout_low Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
      @ (cross (V(sigin) - sigtrig_high,1)  Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
      @ (cross (V(sigin) - sigtrig_high,1) )

 Correction Criteria：Missing closing parenthesis for the cross function call, creating unbalanced parentheses in the event control statement.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
(* instrument_module Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
(* instrument_module *)

 Correction Criteria：Unterminated attribute: Missing closing '*)' delimiter for the attribute declaration

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter integer hyst_state_init=1 Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
inpu sigin; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   anlog begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
   analog begin

 Correction Criteria：Misspelled 'analog' keyword as 'anlog', which is not recognized in VerilogA syntax.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
   integer hyst_state Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
output sigout Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter reel sigout_low = -1; Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
parameter real sigout_low = -1 Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
      end els begin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.

corrected code：
      end else begin

 Correction Criteria：Misspelled 'else' keyword as 'els', causing a syntax error due to unrecognized identifier

Please correct the problematic Verilog-A code below:
input sigin Please provide the corrected code and the Correction Criteria.
